the crazies. Left and right are not always at odds. In Donald Rumsfeld 's autobiography, we see him strike unstereotypical positions, pro civil rights, pro Kennedy. He admiringly quotes a Belgian ambassador: What one needs in life are the pessimism of intelligence and the optimism of will. Doesn't that describe Ronald Reagan , and Winston Churchill , heroes of the right? Yet the quote originally comes from the Italian communist Antonio Gramsci . Politics can coalesce- the Iraq war even united William Hague and Christopher Hitchens .
